text: If you’re like me and you’ve been following The Matrix film series, you’ll be thrilled to know that in today’s lesson we’ll be looking at
the fourth instalment of this iconic movie, The Matrix Resurrection.
Neo, played by Keanu Reeves is back and once again has us questioning our perception of reality
as the battle between humans and machines continues.

But before we get plugged into the trailer as well
as an interview, I’d like to remind you that:

If you’d like to continue learning with us so that
you can understand your favorite TV series and movies
without getting lost, without missing the jokes and without subtitles,
be sure to hit that subscribe button and the bell down below, so you never miss out on any of our new lessons.

Just like Karina who says that she now watches one of our lessons
every morning as part of her morning routine.
So, let’s get into The Matrix Resurrection!
One of the biggest challenges I’ve faced when learning a new language is trying to understand things that are not said.
Things like tone, word stress and humor.
It can be very frustrating, embarrassing and worst of all, demotivating.

To help with this and other language obstacles,
we’ve created our Fluent with Friends course.

Here, you will not only have fun while learning words and 
expressions from the TV series Friends,
but also how to apply them naturally in your daily life!
Along with this, we will guide you to understand native pronunciation, connected speech, as well as the cultural context of the jokes,
so that you can enjoy them more fully.
What’s more, you can try it for free right now with our 3 part masterclass!
Simply click up here or down in the description below.
Watch next: Now, before we get into the quiz, don't forget to subscribe so you don't miss out on any of our lessons,
like this one we created all about Keanu Reeves.

I hope you enjoyed today's lesson. And if you did, you can keep on learning with
The Matrix with this lesson we made for the first movie.
Let's check it out now!
